item.title: Lisa add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "A breeze shook rain out of new leaves onto their hair, but in their pursuit of eternity they never noticed the chill." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Kay Ryan
item.description: "The day misspent, the love misplaced, has inside it the seed of redemption. Nothing is exempt from resurrection." -- Kay Ryan

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Lisa add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description: "I will take the sun in my mouth and leap into the ripe air Alive with closed eyes to dash against darkness" -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Lisa add a quote by pleasefindthis
item.description: "Be soft. Do not let the world make you hard. Do not let pain make you hate. Do not let the bitterness steal your sweetness. Take pride that even though the rest of the world may disagree, you still believe it to be a beautiful place." -- pleasefindthis

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Arthur Schopenhauer
item.description: "Talent hits a target no one else can hit. Genius hits a target no one else can see." -- Arthur Schopenhauer

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Michael Cunningham
item.description: "The secret of flight is this -- you have to do it immediately, before your body realizes it is defying the laws." -- Michael Cunningham

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Love blurs your vision; but after it recedes, you can see more clearly than ever. It's like the tide going out, revealing whatever's been thrown away and sunk: broken bottles, old gloves, rusting pop cans, nibbled fishbodies, bones. This is the kind of thing you see if you sit in the darkness with open eyes, not knowing the future." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "â€ŽLife is a shipwreck, but we must not forget to sing in the lifeboats." -- Voltaire

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Arundhati Roy
item.description: "To love. To be loved. To never forget your own insignificance. To never get used to the unspeakable violence and the vulgar disparity of life around you. To seek joy in the saddest places. To pursue beauty to its lair. To never simplify what is complicated or complicate what is simple. To respect strength, never power. Above all, to watch. To try and understand. To never look away. And never, never to forget." -- Arundhati Roy

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Clothes make the man. Naked people have little or no influence on society." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "It makes you wonder. All the brilliant things we might have done with our lives if only we suspected we knew how." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "Grammar is a piano I play by ear." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Not knowing when the dawn will come I open every door." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Lisa add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Some day you will be old enough to start reading fairy tales again." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Lisa add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "For last year's words belong to last year's language And next year's words await another voice." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Lisa add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Susan Sontag
item.description: "My library is an archive of longings." -- Susan Sontag

item.title: Lisa add a quote by R.A. Salvatore
item.description: "It is better, I think, to grab at the stars than to sit flustered because you know you cannot reach them." -- R.A. Salvatore

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "There comes a time when one must take a position that is neither safe, nor politic, nor popular, but he must take it because conscience tells him it is right." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Lisa add a quote by August Strindberg
item.description: "Life is not so idiotically mathematical that only the big eat the small; it is just as common for a bee to kill a lion or at least to drive it mad." -- August Strindberg

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jack London
item.description: "I'd rather sing one wild song and burst my heart with it, than live a thousand years watching my digestion and being afraid of the wet." -- Jack London

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "Begin at the beginning," the King said, very gravely, "and go on till you come to the end: then stop." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Thomas Merton
item.description: "The beginning of love is the will to let those we love be perfectly themselves, the resolution not to twist them to fit our own image." -- Thomas Merton

item.title: Lisa add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "And then I asked him with my eyes to ask again yes and then he asked me would I yes and his heart was going like mad and yes I said yes I will yes." -- James Joyce

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Dylan Thomas
item.description: "Do not go gentle into that good night. Rage, rage against the dying of the light." -- Dylan Thomas

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "Every man has his secret sorrows which the world knows not; and often times we call a man cold when he is only sad." -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "But better to get hurt by the truth than comforted with a lie." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Vita Sackville-West
item.description: "Damn you, spoilt creature; I shanâ€™t make you love me any the more by giving myself away like this." -- Vita Sackville-West

item.title: Lisa add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fault, dear Brutus, is not in our stars, but in ourselves." -- William Shakespeare
